In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **B** serves the following purposes:

- b represents a [blob](/wiki/Blob "Blob"):

  - b [acid blob](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob")
  - b [quivering blob](/wiki/Quivering_blob "Quivering blob")
  - b [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube")

* B represents a [bat or bird](/wiki/Bat_or_bird "Bat or bird"):

  - B [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat")
  - B [giant bat](/wiki/Giant_bat "Giant bat")
  - B [raven](/wiki/Raven "Raven")
  - B [vampire bat](/wiki/Vampire_bat "Vampire bat")

- It is also used as a [direction](/wiki/Direction "Direction") key if [numpad](/wiki/Numpad "Numpad") movement is off:

  - Press [b]() to move south-west.
  - Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [b]() to move far south-west.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

## Historical uses

In hack121, a port of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), bats and vampire bats used the b glyph, while giant bears used the B glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), the B glyph is given to bats, and the b glyph is given to the [giant beetle](/wiki/Giant_beetle "Giant beetle"). Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

The bat still uses B as its current glyph, while the giant beetle retains its b glyph up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"). In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), giant beetles are moved to a with other [insects](/wiki/Insect "Insect"), and the [blob](/wiki/Blob "Blob") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") is created and given the b glyph; the acid blob, quivering blob and gelatinous cube are moved to the blob monster class.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces several new monsters that use the b and B glyphs:

- b blob:

  - b [jiggling blob](/wiki/Jiggling_blob "Jiggling blob")
  - b [lava blob](/wiki/Lava_blob "Lava blob")
  - b [static blob](/wiki/Static_blob "Static blob")
  - b [burbling blob](/wiki/Burbling_blob "Burbling blob")

- B bat or bird:

  - B [rhumbat](/wiki/Rhumbat "Rhumbat")
  - B [athol](/wiki/Athol "Athol")
  - B [hellbat](/wiki/Hellbat "Hellbat")
  - B [mongbat](/wiki/Mongbat "Mongbat")
  - B [mobat](/wiki/Mobat "Mobat")
  - B [harpy](/wiki/Harpy "Harpy")
  - B [byakhee](/wiki/Byakhee "Byakhee")
  - B [Nightgaunt (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Nightgaunt_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightgaunt (SLASH'EM)")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces several new monsters that use the b and B glyphs:

- b blob:

  - b [blob of preserved organs](/wiki/Blob_of_preserved_organs "Blob of preserved organs")
  - b [crystal ooze](/wiki/Crystal_ooze "Crystal ooze")
  - b [blood bloater](/wiki/Blood_bloater "Blood bloater")
  - b [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(dNetHack\) "Shoggoth (dNetHack)")
  - b [priest of Ghaunadaur](/wiki/Priest_of_Ghaunadaur "Priest of Ghaunadaur")
  - b [mothering mass](/wiki/Mothering_mass "Mothering mass")
  - b [coiling brawn](/index.php?title=Coiling_brawn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Coiling brawn (page does not exist)")
  - b [deep blue cube](/index.php?title=Deep_blue_cube\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Deep blue cube (page does not exist)")
  - b [pitch black cube](/index.php?title=Pitch_black_cube\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pitch black cube (page does not exist)")
  - b [perfectly clear cube](/index.php?title=Perfectly_clear_cube\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Perfectly clear cube (page does not exist)")

* B bat or bird:

  - B [parrot](/wiki/Parrot "Parrot")
  - B [crow](/wiki/Crow "Crow")
  - B [battle-bat](/wiki/Battle-bat "Battle-bat")
  - B [warbat](/wiki/Warbat "Warbat")
  - B [chiropteran](/wiki/Chiropteran "Chiropteran")
  - B [byakhee](/wiki/Byakhee "Byakhee")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

B

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter B serves the following purposes:

  • b represents a blob:
    • b acid blob
    • b quivering blob
    • b gelatinous cube
  • B represents a bat or bird:
    • B bat
    • B giant bat
    • B raven
    • B vampire bat
  • It is also used as a direction key if numpad movement is off:
    • Press b to move south-west.
    • Press shift + b to move far south-west.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 dNetHack

Historical uses

In hack121, a port of Jay Fenlason's Hack, bats and vampire bats used the b glyph, while giant bears used the B glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and Hack 1.0, the B glyph is given to bats, and the b glyph is given to the giant beetle. Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in Hack 1.0.

The bat still uses B as its current glyph, while the giant beetle retains its b glyph up to NetHack 2.3e. In NetHack 3.0.0, giant beetles are moved to a with other insects, and the blob monster class is created and given the b glyph; the acid blob, quivering blob and gelatinous cube are moved to the blob monster class.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces several new monsters that use the b and B glyphs:

  • b blob:
    • b jiggling blob
    • b lava blob
    • b static blob
    • b burbling blob
  • B bat or bird:
    • B rhumbat
    • B athol
    • B hellbat
    • B mongbat
    • B mobat
    • B harpy
    • B byakhee
    • B Nightgaunt (SLASH'EM)

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces several new monsters that use the b and B glyphs:

  • b blob:
    • b blob of preserved organs
    • b crystal ooze
    • b blood bloater
    • b shoggoth
    • b priest of Ghaunadaur
    • b mothering mass
    • b coiling brawn
    • b deep blue cube
    • b pitch black cube
    • b perfectly clear cube
  • B bat or bird:
    • B parrot
    • B crow
    • B battle-bat
    • B warbat
    • B chiropteran
    • B byakhee
